page.title: 09CROFTING
page.content: { Crofters}in this area rarely work the ground apart from planting a potato crop and cutting hay in the Autumn to feed their animals. The majority of them keep a few sheep , only a few have any cattle, goats. Hens are useful for eggs due to the distance from shops. Sheep are{dipped }two or three times and clipped in June or July. Every year sheep or lambs are gathered and put into{fanks}(pens).They are then sorted and taken by lorry to {Dingwall or{Lairg Auctions.}A good price for a hog(one year old) would be around Â£40. Usually the wether (male) lambs are sold keeping the ewe lambs for breeding in later years. Sheep in lamb need extra feeding in the harsh winter conditions. A good {Collie dog}is an asset to any crofter.
